page.title: 13TRANSPORT FROM N.S.
page.content: Newton Stewart has four main roads radiating from it.One leads north towards Glasgow,one south through towns and villages to the coast,one west towards Stranraer,and one east towards Dumfries.The road which runs east to west is the{A75} Euororoute.Newton Stewart was bypassed in recent years because of the large lorries coming through.In Newton Stewart we have no railway.We had one running from{Stranraer to Dumfries, } passing through Gatehouse,Castle Douglas,and other places.It was closed down in the 1960s because not enough people were using it.Our two nearest stations are Barrhill,about 17 miles to the north,and Stranraer,about 25 miles to the west.Stranraer is one of the two ports on Loch Ryan,and{Sealink do a short sea crossing to{Larne}in Northern Ireland.
